summary: This document is a response from Oath Holdings Inc. (formerly Yahoo Holdings, Inc.) to a subpoena issued on December 19, 2018, regarding user accounts related to the Epstein investigation. The response indicates that two specified accounts were not valid Yahoo addresses, and provides information on remaining accounts as requested.

persons.name: Alyssa Anderson
persons.role: Legal Analyst, Law Enforcement Response at Oath Holdings Inc.
persons.context: Author of the response letter, providing information from Oath Holdings Inc. regarding subpoenaed user accounts.

events.title: Subpoena Issued for Yahoo Account Information
events.description: A subpoena was issued requesting information pertaining to user accounts including columbiadentall@yahoo.com and jeffreyepsteinorg, among others.

events.title: Oath Holdings Response to Subpoena
events.description: Oath Holdings Inc. (formerly Yahoo Holdings, Inc.) responded to the subpoena, indicating two accounts were not valid and providing data on remaining accounts.

keyFacts: A subpoena was issued on December 19, 2018, seeking information on Yahoo user accounts including 'columbiadentall@yahoo.com' and 'jeffreyepsteinorg'.
Oath Holdings Inc. (formerly Yahoo) responded that the accounts 'columbiadentall' and 'jeffreyepsteinorg' were not valid Yahoo email addresses or IDs at the time of the search.
The response indicates law enforcement was investigating digital communications potentially linked to Jeffrey Epstein, as suggested by the 'jeffreyepsteinorg' account name.
The document shows ongoing investigative activity into Epstein-related matters as of early 2019, following the initial 2018 charges.
The response was prepared by Alyssa Anderson, a Legal Analyst for Law Enforcement Response at Oath Holdings Inc.
